hiraya-core.name: hiraya-core

hiraya-game.name: hiraya-game
hiraya-game.description: A basic game entity that has basic API like stats, attack and damage commands.

Hiraya.Class.name: Hiraya.Class

Hiraya.Collection.name: Hiraya.Collection
Hiraya.Collection.description: `Hiraya.Collection` handles list of objects that can be stored and retrieved.

Hiraya.Emitter.name: Hiraya.Emitter

Hiraya.GetterSetter.name: Hiraya.GetterSetter

Hiraya.Entity.name: Hiraya.Entity
Hiraya.Entity.description: A basic game entity that has basic API like stats, attack and damage commands.

Hiraya.Game.name: Hiraya.Game
Hiraya.Game.description:
`Hiraya.Game` is the entry point of the framework. Instantiating this will serve as your namespace,
as well as reference to instantiated objects that the Hiraya framework provides.

    Game = Hiraya.Game.create();
    Game.start(); // Game does its work like preloading assets, initializing classes, etc.

Hiraya.LevelTurnBased.name: Hiraya.LevelTurnBased
Hiraya.LevelTurnBased.description:
`Hiraya.LevelTurnBased` manages entities and game logic for turn-based games.

### Events

- `getTurnTimedOut`
- `gotTurn`
- `hasNoWinnerYet`
- `hasWinner`

Hiraya.Level.name: Hiraya.Level
Hiraya.Level.description:
`Hiraya.Level` manages the game logic and entity interaction.

### Events

- `addedEntity`

Hiraya.Stat.name: Hiraya.Stat
Hiraya.Stat.description:
`Hiraya.Stat` manages the values for an RPG attribute.
It handles things like making sure the value doesn't exceed its maximum capacity.

It also provides some useful API for value manipulation.

Hiraya.Stats.name: Hiraya.Stats
Hiraya.Stats.description:
`Hiraya.Stats` handles all stat related object. This is quite useful as a container
for all attributes for a character to prevent clutter in the attributes of a `Hiraya.Entity` instance.

Although it is used primarily for RPG stats, you are free to use it elsewhere.

    var stats = Hiraya.Stats.create();
    stats
      .set('health', 100)
      .set('mana', 100);

Hiraya.Tile.name: Hiraya.Tile
Hiraya.Tile.description: A tile for a level with tiles

Hiraya.Tiles.name: Hiraya.Tiles
Hiraya.Tiles.description: `Hiraya.Tiles` manages `Hiraya.Tile` instances which includes selecting neighbors and path-finding.

classitems.description: Increases the value of the stat. Increments the `.value` property by 1 if the value argument is undefined.

classitems.description: Reduces the value by one. Decrements the `.value` property by 1 if the value argument is undefined.

classitems.description: Default stat object returned in the `.get` method. Has a value of 1 and max value of 1.

classitems.description: Sets or creates the value of a stat attribute. You can optionally set the max value as well
classitems.name: set

classitems.description:
Returns a stat attribute by name. Returns an empty stat object if the stat name doesn't exist.

    var stats = Hiraya.Stats.create();
    stats
      .set('health', 100)
      .set('mana', 100);
    stats.get('health').value; // -> 100
    stats.get('noneExistingStatName').value; // -> 0
